# # Steps to visualization - Grocery Pharma

# clean colnames

```{r}
cmvv_avg100k <- cmvv_avg100k %>% rename(
  svi = `Social Vulnerability Index (SVI)`,
  svi_cat = `SVI Category`,
cvac =  `Ability to handle a COVID-19 outbreak (CVAC)`,
  cvac_cat = `CVAC Category`,
  retail_rec_pctchange = retail_and_recreation_percent_change_from_baseline,
  grocery_pharma_pctchange = grocery_and_pharmacy_percent_change_from_baseline,
  parks_pctchange = parks_percent_change_from_baseline,
  transit_pctchange = transit_stations_percent_change_from_baseline ,
  work_pctchange = workplaces_percent_change_from_baseline,
  residential_pctchange = residential_percent_change_from_baseline,
  pct_hisp = `Percent Hispanic`,
  pct_native = `Percent non-Hispanic American Indian/Alaska Native`,
   pct_asian = `Percent non-Hispanic Asian`,
pct_black = `Percent non-Hispanic Black`,
  pct_pi =`Percent non-Hispanic Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander`,
   pct_white = `Percent non-Hispanic White`
  
)

cmvv_avg100k <- cmvv_avg100k %>% mutate(holiday = ifelse(month(date)==11 | month(date)==12, 1, 0))
```


# Develop regression for all states

switched from risk group to straight numbers per capita in this

```{r}
all_state1 <- lm(grocery_pharma_pctchange ~us_cases_avg_per_100k + st_cases_avg_per_100k + co_cases_avg_per_100k, data = cmvv_avg100k)

summary(all_state1)

all_state1 <- tidy(all_state1)

all_state2 <- lm(grocery_pharma_pctchange ~ us_cases_avg_per_100k + st_cases_avg_per_100k + co_cases_avg_per_100k + svi + per_gop, data = cmvv_avg100k)

#summary(all_state2)

all_state2 <- tidy(all_state2)

all_state3 <- lm(grocery_pharma_pctchange~us_cases_avg_per_100k + st_cases_avg_per_100k + co_cases_avg_per_100k + svi + per_gop + pct_black + pct_hisp + pct_asian + pct_native + pct_pi, data = cmvv_avg100k)

#summary(all_state3)

all_state3 <- tidy(all_state3)


all_state4 <- lm(grocery_pharma_pctchange~us_cases_avg_per_100k + st_cases_avg_per_100k + co_cases_avg_per_100k + svi + cvac + per_gop + pct_black + pct_hisp + pct_asian + pct_native + pct_pi, data = cmvv_avg100k)

#summary(all_state4)

all_state4 <- tidy(all_state4)


all_state5 <- lm(grocery_pharma_pctchange~us_cases_avg_per_100k + st_cases_avg_per_100k + co_cases_avg_per_100k + svi_fac + cvac_fac + per_gop + maj_minority, data = cmvv_avg100k)

#summary(all_state5)


all_state5 <- tidy(all_state5)

all_state6 <- lm(grocery_pharma_pctchange~us_cases_avg_per_100k + st_cases_avg_per_100k + co_cases_avg_per_100k + svi + cvac + per_gop*`Estimated hesitant` + maj_minority, data = cmvv_avg100k)

#summary(all_state6)


all_state6 <- tidy(all_state6)



all_state7 <- lm(grocery_pharma_pctchange~us_cases_avg_per_100k + st_cases_avg_per_100k + co_cases_avg_per_100k + svi + cvac + per_gop +`Estimated hesitant` + maj_minority, data = cmvv_avg100k)

#summary(all_state7)

all_state7 <- tidy(all_state7)

all_state8 <- lm(grocery_pharma_pctchange~us_cases_avg_per_100k + st_cases_avg_per_100k + co_cases_avg_per_100k + svi + cvac + per_gop*`Estimated hesitant` + pct_black + pct_hisp + pct_asian + pct_native + pct_pi + holiday, data = cmvv_avg100k)

#summary(all_state8)

all_state8 <- tidy(all_state8)

```


# create DF and for loop

```{r}





gp_state_results <- data.frame(
  term = all_state8$term
)

sn <- statename %>% filter(state %in% cmvv_avg100k$sub_region_1, state!="Alaska", state!="Hawaii") %>% arrange(state)

sn <- sn$state

gp_adjrsq <- numeric(0)

#missingness with alaska
#sn <- sort(sn) %>% filter(sn %in% cmvv_avg100k$sub_region_1)

for (s in sn) {
  temp_df <- cmvv_avg100k %>% filter(sub_region_1==s) %>% select(grocery_pharma_pctchange, us_cases_avg_per_100k, st_cases_avg_per_100k, co_cases_avg_per_100k, svi, cvac, per_gop, `Estimated hesitant`, pct_black, pct_hisp, pct_asian, pct_native, pct_pi, holiday) %>% drop_na()
  #print(s)
  
  temp_df$sub_region_1
  
  c_name <- paste("coeff", s, sep = "_")
  p_name <- paste("pval", s, sep = "_")
  
  temp_reg <- lm(grocery_pharma_pctchange~us_cases_avg_per_100k + st_cases_avg_per_100k + co_cases_avg_per_100k + svi + cvac + per_gop*`Estimated hesitant` + pct_black + pct_hisp + pct_asian + pct_native + pct_pi + holiday, data = temp_df)
  
  
  temp_rsq <- summary(temp_reg)$adj.r.squared
  
  #print(temp_rsq)
  gp_adjrsq <-c(gp_adjrsq, temp_rsq)
  
  temp_reg <- tidy(temp_reg)
  
  gp_state_results[[c_name]] <- temp_reg$estimate
  gp_state_results[[p_name]] <- temp_reg$p.value
  #state_results <- state_results %>% mutate(c_name = temp_reg$estimate, p_name <-temp_reg$p.value)
  
  
}


```
# pivoting df

```{r}
gp_long_state_results <- gp_state_results %>% pivot_longer(cols = c(coeff_Alabama:pval_Wyoming), names_to = c("est_pval", "state"), names_sep = "_")

gp_wide_state_results <- gp_long_state_results %>% pivot_wider(names_from = term, values_from = value)

gp_state_coeffs <- gp_wide_state_results %>% filter(est_pval=="coeff")
```
adding mutations now so they are included in future merges
```{r}
gp_state_coeffs <- gp_state_coeffs %>% mutate(
  nat_pctile = ntile(us_cases_avg_per_100k, 5),
  st_pctile = ntile(st_cases_avg_per_100k, 5),
  co_pctile = ntile(co_cases_avg_per_100k, 5),
  
  nat_pctile = factor(nat_pctile, levels = c(1:5), labels = c("20%", "40%", "60%", "80%", "100%"), ordered = TRUE),
  st_pctile = factor(st_pctile, levels = c(1:5), labels = c("20%", "40%", "60%", "80%", "100%"), ordered = TRUE),
  co_pctile = factor(co_pctile, levels = c(1:5), labels = c("20%", "40%", "60%", "80%", "100%"), ordered = TRUE),
  
  nat_pos = ifelse(us_cases_avg_per_100k>=0,1,0),
  st_pos = ifelse(st_cases_avg_per_100k>=0,1,0),
  co_pos = ifelse(co_cases_avg_per_100k>=0,1,0),
  
  nat_pos = factor(nat_pos, levels=c(0:1), labels = c("-", "+"), ordered = TRUE),
  
  st_pos = factor(st_pos, levels=c(0:1), labels = c("-", "+"), ordered = TRUE),
  
  co_pos = factor(co_pos, levels=c(0:1), labels = c("-", "+"), ordered = TRUE)
  
)
```

```{r}
summary(gp_state_coeffs$us_cases_avg_per_100k)
summary(gp_state_coeffs$st_cases_avg_per_100k)
summary(gp_state_coeffs$co_cases_avg_per_100k)

us_outliers<-boxplot(gp_state_coeffs$us_cases_avg_per_100k)$out
st_outliers<-boxplot(gp_state_coeffs$st_cases_avg_per_100k)$out
co_outliers<-boxplot(gp_state_coeffs$co_cases_avg_per_100k)$out

gp_state_coeffs %>% ggplot() + 
  geom_boxplot(mapping = aes(y=us_cases_avg_per_100k))

gp_state_coeffs %>% ggplot() + 
  geom_boxplot(mapping = aes(y=st_cases_avg_per_100k))
gp_state_coeffs %>% ggplot() + 
  geom_boxplot(mapping = aes(y=co_cases_avg_per_100k))
```



#rejoining geospatial data

```{r}
# adding fips back in

gp_state_coeffs <- left_join(gp_state_coeffs, statename)

gp_state_coeffs <- gp_state_coeffs %>% rename(intercept = `(Intercept)`)

gp_state_geo_coeffs <- right_join(census_spatial, gp_state_coeffs, by = c("GEOID"="sfips"))
```

# geospatial charts -- intercept

```{r}
gp_state_geo_coeffs %>%  ggplot() + 
  geom_sf(mapping = aes(fill = intercept/100)) + scale_fill_distiller(palette = "YlOrRd", name = "Average Traffic Change")
```
```{r}
gp_state_geo_coeffs %>%  ggplot() + 
  geom_sf(mapping = aes(fill = us_cases_avg_per_100k)) + scale_fill_distiller(palette = "YlOrRd", name = "Average Traffic Change") + labs(title = "GP - Responsiveness to National Level Cases")


gp_state_geo_coeffs %>%  ggplot() + 
  geom_sf(mapping = aes(fill = st_cases_avg_per_100k)) + scale_fill_distiller(palette = "YlOrRd", name = "Average Traffic Change") + labs(title = "GP - Responsiveness to State Level Cases")

gp_state_geo_coeffs %>%  ggplot() + 
  geom_sf(mapping = aes(fill = co_cases_avg_per_100k)) + scale_fill_distiller(palette = "YlOrRd", name = "Average Traffic Change") + labs(title = "GP - Responsiveness to County Level Cases")
```
# Scaling with Ntile to avoid outlier skew

note_ the challenge is when the skew is positive for some and negative for others. maybe make that a color param?

color param was pretty hard to interpret. new goal: create df for outliers, then layer



```{r}
gp_state_geo_coeffs %>%  ggplot() + 
  geom_sf(mapping = aes(fill = nat_pctile, color = nat_pos)) + scale_fill_brewer(palette = "YlOrRd", name = "Average Traffic Change") + scale_color_manual(values = c("black", "white")) + labs(title = "GP - Responsiveness to National Level Cases")


gp_state_geo_coeffs %>%  ggplot() + 
  geom_sf(mapping = aes(fill = st_pctile, color = st_pos)) + scale_fill_brewer(palette = "YlOrRd", name = "Average Traffic Change") + scale_color_manual(values = c("black", "white")) + labs(title = "GP - Responsiveness to State Level Cases")

gp_state_geo_coeffs %>%  ggplot() + 
  geom_sf(mapping = aes(fill = co_pctile, color = co_pos)) + scale_fill_brewer(palette = "YlOrRd", name = "Average Traffic Change") + scale_color_manual(values = c("black", "white")) + labs(title = "GP - Responsiveness to County Level Cases")
```
# Layering in Rsq

```{r}
gp_state_adjrsq <- data_frame(
  state = sn,
  adj.r.squared = gp_adjrsq
  
)

gp_state_geo_coeffs <- left_join(gp_state_geo_coeffs, gp_state_adjrsq, by = "state")
```


```{r}

```
